value.title: Page Navigation Buttons in Power BI
value.excerpt: Previously, to create page navigation in Power BI, you needed to create bookmarks, and buttons to action to that bookmark. However, recently, in the last version of Power BI Desktop, the ability to easily navigate to other pages using Buttons in announced. In this short video, I'll explain how you can

value.title: Power BI Date or Calendar Table Best Method   DAX or Power Query
value.excerpt: So you want to create a date or calendar table in Power BI, and you search for ways to do that. Then you will find many different approaches for that. Some of the approaches are using Power Query, some are using DAX. Which method is the best? What is the actual difference between a date table created

value.title: Power BI DAX RelatedTable Function   Get the subtable related to the current row
value.excerpt: There are multiple functions that can help when you work with tables that are connected through relationships. One of these functions is Relatedtable. This function gives you the subtable from the other table for all the rows related to the current row. For example, all sales transactions (from the Sales
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/ZrhnliV7Jrw" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Power BI Filter pane   Customize the Color Font and Style
value.excerpt: You can apply filters on visualizations in Power BI using the Filter pane. Filters can be applied in scopes of the report, page, or visual level. I explained that in this article. You can also customize the filter’s pane so that it hides or locks filters from the user’s view. And last but not least,

value.title: Power BI Subscription   Get Report Updates In Email
value.excerpt: Have you ever wondered is it possible to have updates of the Power BI report to be emailed to you (or some other colleagues) on a daily basis? Power BI, fortunately, has this feature, it is called Subscription. Subscriptions are helpful ways to send an up-to-date version of the report and dashboard to

value.title: Power BI Theme   Customize Colors Fonts and Visual Appearance for Multiple Objects
value.excerpt: If you build a report for an enterprise, you might be limited to use the organization-approved colors. It is also useful to have your reports following a template of colors, and fonts, which might look like your signature of the report. In Power BI, you can do that with Theme. In this article, I’ll explain

value.title: Power BI User Access Levels   Build and Edit are different
value.excerpt: Often I have seen Power BI users have access to the areas that they shouldn’t. In Power BI, you can share a report with a user just for view only, or give them access to view and built, or to Edit. These are all different levels of access. Build access is the one that is often is confused with Edit.

value.title: Substring in DAX   How to get Part of String Field in Power BI Using DAX Expression

value.excerpt: Small multiple is a relatively recent feature on some of the Power BI visuals. value.title: What is Premium Per User License for Power BI, and What is it good for
value.excerpt: One of the great news in Microsoft Ignite 2020 is the announcement of a new licensing plan for Microsoft Power BI, called Premium Per User, or Premium Gen2. In this article, I'll explain what that is, and how this can be helpful for Power BI users. value.title: Computing a measure in DAX Studio
value.excerpt: You can use DAX Studio to evaluate one or more measures in your data model. This is the first step to write, test, and debug your DAX measures in a productive manner.  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.org/

value.title: Customize default values for each user in Power BI reports
value.excerpt: Learn how to use calculation groups to define a default set of values for columns in your model. Different users can have different default values, and yet retain the full capability to select different values. Article and download: https://sql.bi/717242?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt

value.title: Filtering a measure in DAX Studio
